intro: Linochilus tergocanus, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Asclepiadaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. The plant is also notable for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a hardy species adapted to dry environments.
